title: Relates to the certifications of disability for severely disabled persons to obtain certain motor vehicle registrations, plates and permits
summary: Relates to the certifications of disability for severely disabled persons to obtain certain motor vehicle registrations, plates and permits.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1340

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                    January 6, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sens. DILAN, DIAZ -- read twice and ordered printed, and
         when printed to be committed to the Committee on Transportation

       AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic  law,  in  relation  to  certif-
         ications of disability for severely disabled persons to obtain certain
         motor vehicle registrations, plates and permits

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The opening paragraph and paragraph (c)  of  subdivision  4
    2  and  paragraph  (b) of subdivision 5 of section 404-a of the vehicle and
    3  traffic law, as amended by chapter 228 of the laws of 2008, are  amended
    4  and a new subdivision 4-b is added to read as follows:
    5    The  commissioner shall issue sets of plates to such person in accord-
    6  ance with subdivision two of this section with proof of such  disability
    7  of  such  person or such members of his family certified by a physician,
    8  physician assistant or nurse practitioner, to the extent  authorized  by
    9  law,  including  the  education  law, and consistent with any applicable
   10  written practice agreement, or podiatrist pursuant to subdivision four-a
   11  of this section OR OPTOMETRIST PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION  FOUR-B  OF  THIS
   12  SECTION,  to  the  satisfaction  of the commissioner who is empowered to
   13  carry out the effects of this section by  formulating  rules  and  regu-
   14  lations.
   15    (c)  Has  a  physical or mental impairment or condition which is other
   16  than those specified above, but is of such nature as to  impose  unusual
   17  hardship  in  utilization  of  public transportation facilities and such
   18  condition is certified by a  physician,  physician  assistant  or  nurse
   19  practitioner,  to  the extent authorized by law, including the education
   20  law, and consistent with any applicable written practice agreement, duly
   21  licensed to practice medicine in this state, or, pursuant to subdivision
   22  four-a of this section, a podiatrist duly licensed to practice  podiatry
   23  in  this  state  OR,  PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION FOUR-B OF THIS SECTION, AN
   24  OPTOMETRIST DULY LICENSED  TO  PRACTICE  OPTOMETRY  IN  THIS  STATE,  as

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03017-01-1

       S. 1340                             2

    1  constituting  an  equal  degree of disability (specifying the particular
    2  condition) so as to prevent such  person  from  getting  around  without
    3  great difficulty in accordance with subdivision two of this section; or
    4    (b)  The  commissioner  may  require the applicant for registration to
    5  furnish such proof of his disability or such proof of disability of such
    6  members of his family from a physician,  physician  assistant  or  nurse
    7  practitioner,  to  the extent authorized by law, including the education
    8  law, and consistent with any applicable written practice  agreement,  or
    9  podiatrist pursuant to subdivision four-a of this section OR OPTOMETRIST
   10  PURSUANT  TO  SUBDIVISION  FOUR-B  OF  THIS SECTION, as the commissioner
   11  deems necessary either for  initial  registration  or  renewal  thereof;
   12  provided,  however,  that  a  handicapped or disabled permit issued by a
   13  municipality to  such  applicant  pursuant  to  section  twelve  hundred
   14  three-a  of  this chapter shall be deemed sufficient proof of disability
   15  for purposes of this paragraph.
   16    4-B. CERTIFICATION OF DISABILITY BY  AN  OPTOMETRIST.  AN  OPTOMETRIST
   17  DULY LICENSED TO PRACTICE OPTOMETRY IN THIS STATE MAY CERTIFY ONLY THOSE
   18  CONDITIONS WHICH HE OR SHE TREATS IN THE COURSE OF THE PRACTICE OF OPTO-
   19  METRY,  AS  DEFINED  IN SECTION SEVENTY-ONE HUNDRED ONE OF THE EDUCATION
   20  LAW.
   21    S 2. Paragraph (i) of subdivision  1  and  subdivision  3  of  section
   22  1203-a of the vehicle and traffic law, paragraph (i) of subdivision 1 as
   23  amended  by chapter 180 of the laws of 1996 and subdivision 3 as amended
   24  by chapter 220 of the laws of 1984, are amended to read as follows:
   25    (i) any resident of New York state who is a severely disabled  person,
   26  as  defined  in subdivision three of section four hundred four-a of this
   27  chapter, upon application of such person  or  such  person's  parent  or
   28  guardian,  provided,  however, that an issuing agent shall issue permits
   29  only to residents of the city, town or village  in  which  such  issuing
   30  agent  is  located,  except  that,  an  issuing  agent,  in  his  or her
   31  discretion, may issue a permit to a severely disabled person who is  not
   32  a  resident of the city, town, or village in which such issuing agent is
   33  located where such person resides in a city, town, or village  in  which
   34  the  governing  body  has not appointed an issuing agent; and an issuing
   35  agent, in his or her discretion, may issue a temporary  special  vehicle
   36  identification  parking  permit,  as  authorized by subdivision three of
   37  this section, to a person who is temporarily unable to ambulate  without
   38  the  aid of an assisting device, as certified by a physician OR AN OPTO-
   39  METRIST PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION FOUR-B OF SECTION FOUR HUNDRED FOUR-A OF
   40  THIS CHAPTER, who resides in a city, town, or village in which the issu-
   41  ing agent does not issue temporary special vehicle identification  park-
   42  ing permits, or who is not a resident of the United States and is tempo-
   43  rarily visiting the state; or
   44    3.  Notwithstanding any provision of this chapter to the contrary, any
   45  municipality may issue a temporary special vehicle identification  park-
   46  ing  permit  to any person who is temporarily unable to ambulate without
   47  the aid of an assisting device, as certified by a physician OR AN  OPTO-
   48  METRIST PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION FOUR-B OF SECTION FOUR HUNDRED FOUR-A OF
   49  THIS  CHAPTER.    Such  temporary special vehicle identification parking
   50  permit shall be valid for not more than six months and shall  be  recog-
   51  nized statewide.
   52    S  3.  This  act shall take effect on the thirtieth day after it shall
   53  have become a law.
